info.title: Endpoints (1): Thrust Calculator
info.description:
The Thrust Calculator is our industry leading product to creating complex carbon calculations, and generating beautiful reports.

#### Getting Started
**If it is your first time here, we suggest visiting the [Getting Started guide](../docs/../1.Getting-started.md).**

#### Resources
* **Projects** - a project is the container for your calculation. Any reports you create are made on a project level.
* **Segments** - a segment is something that generates an emission (e.g. flight, hotel stay, delivery, raw material purchase). 
* **Offset Options** - an offset option represents a carbon offset that may be attached to your project.
* **Offset** - a carbon offset which has been added to an offset. This may be in a state of pending, completed (i.e. purchased), or expired.

> 
> _Please note: you can manually perform these actions via your Thrust Carbon dashboard_

Provides a list of offset options available for this project. You can use this list to:
* Display a list of offset opportunities to your users.
* Take a returned offset option and attach it to your project. Once an offset is attached, you can purchase the offset by finalising the project.

Please note: at this time, you will need to contact ThrustCarbon directly to purchase more than 1,000 tonnes in a single purchase.

tonnes_of_co2.description: Number of tonnes of co2 you would like to purchase.

price_per_tonne.description:
In base units (e.g. USD cent, GBP pennies, etc).

Optional. If you provide a price-per-tonne, your request will be validated against the current price-per-tonne and return an error if that price is no longer valid.

We recommend providing this parameter to verify that the price hasn't moved between requesting an offset option and attaching an offset.

is_sandbox.description: Defaults to false. Change to true to create real offsets in production (warning, this will incur fees if you later confirm these offsets).
